010package imagingbook.common.math.jama;
011
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonSquareMatrixException;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015
016import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019
020@Deprecated 
021public class CholeskyDecomposition {
022
023    public static final double DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD = 1.0e-15;
024    public static final double DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD = 1.0e-10;
025
026        private final double[][] L;                             // array for internal storage of decomposition
027        private final int n;                                    // row and column dimension (square matrix)
028        private final boolean isPosDefinite;    // symmetric and positive definite flag
029
030        /**
031         * 
032         * @param matrix a square, symmetric matrix to be decomposed
033         * @param relativeSymmetryThreshold 
034         *              threshold above which off-diagonal elements are considered too different and matrix not symmetric
035         * @param absolutePositivityThreshold
036         *              threshold below which diagonal elements are considered null and matrix not positive definite
037         * @throws NonSquareMatrixException if the matrix is not square
038         */
039    public CholeskyDecomposition(RealMatrix matrix, double relativeSymmetryThreshold, double absolutePositivityThreshold) {
040                if (!matrix.isSquare()) {
041                        throw new NonSquareMatrixException(matrix.getRowDimension(), matrix.getColumnDimension());
042                }
043
044                final double[][] A = matrix.getData();
045                this.n = matrix.getRowDimension();
046                this.L = new double[n][n];
047
048                boolean posDef = true;
049                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
050                        final double[] Lrowj = L[j];
051                        double d = 0.0;
052                        for (int k = 0; k < j; k++) {
053                                if (Arithmetic.isZero(L[k][k])) {
054                                        throw new RuntimeException("encountered zero diagonal value at pos. " + k);
055                                }
056                                final double[] Lrowk = L[k];
057                                double s = 0.0;
058                                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
059                                        s += Lrowk[i] * Lrowj[i];
060                                }
061//                              Lrowj[k] = s = (A[j][k] - s) / L[k][k];
062                                s = (A[j][k] - s) / L[k][k];
063                                Lrowj[k] = s;
064                                d = d + s * s;
065                                posDef = posDef & Arithmetic.equals(A[k][j], A[j][k], relativeSymmetryThreshold); // (A[k][j] == A[j][k]);
066                        }
067                        d = A[j][j] - d;
068                        posDef = posDef & (d > absolutePositivityThreshold);
069                        L[j][j] = Math.sqrt(Math.max(d, 0.0));
070                        for (int k = j + 1; k < n; k++) {
071                                L[j][k] = 0.0;
072                        }
073                }
074
075                this.isPosDefinite = posDef;
076    }
077    
078    
079        /**
080         * Constructor.
081         * 
082         * @param matrix a square, symmetric matrix
083         * @throws NonSquareMatrixException if the matrix is not square
084         */
085        public CholeskyDecomposition(RealMatrix matrix) {
086                this(matrix, DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD, DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD);
087        }
088
089
090        /**
091         * Checks if the matrix symmetric and positive definite.
092         * @return true if the decomposed matrix is symmetric and positive definite
093         */
094        public boolean isPositiveDefinite() {
095                return isPosDefinite;
096        }
097
098        /**
099         * Returns the triangular factor matrix.
100         * @return the matrix L
101         */
102        public RealMatrix getL() {
103                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(L);
104        }
105        
106        
107        
108

115//       * @exception RuntimeException Matrix is not symmetric positive definite.
116//       */
117//

155        
156        
157        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
158        
159        public static void main(String[] args) {
160                        
161                /**
162                 * This symmetric 6x6 has only rank 5 and cannot be handled by Apache Common Maths's
163                 * Cholesky implementation:
164                 */
165                RealMatrix B = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
166                        {2497883442.0, 762966565.0, 326612325.0, 15097274.0, 4845135.0, 94770.0}, 
167                        {762966565.0, 326612325.0, 188262895.0, 4845135.0, 2264945.0, 32815.0}, 
168                        {326612325.0, 188262895.0, 130208963.0, 2264945.0, 1433555.0, 17519.0}, 
169                        {15097274.0, 4845135.0, 2264945.0, 94770.0, 32815.0, 638.0}, 
170                        {4845135.0, 2264945.0, 1433555.0, 32815.0, 17519.0, 257.0}, 
171                        {94770.0, 32815.0, 17519.0, 638.0, 257.0, 5.0}});
172                
173                {
174                        System.out.println("B = \n" + Matrix.toString(B));
175                        CholeskyDecomposition cd = new CholeskyDecomposition(B);
176                        System.out.println("isPositiveDefinite = " + cd.isPositiveDefinite());
177                        RealMatrix L = cd.getL();
178                        System.out.println("L = \n" + Matrix.toString(L));
179                        System.out.println("L * LT = \n" + Matrix.toString(L.multiply(L.transpose())));
180                }
181                
182//              {
183//                      System.out.println("B = \n" + Matrix.toString(B));
184//                      org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition cd = new org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition(B);
185//                      RealMatrix L = cd.getL();
186//                      System.out.println("L = \n" + Matrix.toString(L));
187//                      System.out.println("L * LT = \n" + Matrix.toString(L.multiply(L.transpose())));
188//              }
189                
190                
191        }
192}
